profiles:
Summary By nature, I am a problem solver; I thrive when given a good challenge. I take the time to understand all the parts of the problem before acting. In this way each step I take is not only effective, but efficient. My passion is what drives me to work tirelessly to successfully complete any project thrown my way, no matter how complex the components are. Experience Associate Director, Custom Programs Stanford University July 2015  – Present (2 months) Stanford Center for Professional Development Professional Education Program Manager Stanford University December 2013  –  July 2015  (1 year 8 months) Stanford Center for Professional Development Develop and manage all aspects of a range of Chinese Executive Education programs at Stanford, in China and online. Responsibilities include business development, proposals and contracts, course development and program execution. Professional Education Program Coordinator Stanford University March 2012  –  December 2013  (1 year 10 months) Stanford Center for Professional Development Provide program coordination for small and large, custom and open enrollment programs serving a range of clients from executives and middle managers to professors and researchers from around the world through the Stanford Center for Professional Development in the School of Engineering. Loan Closing Support First Republic Bank September 2011  –  December 2011  (4 months) San Francisco The main source of support for the Loan Closing Department, 17+ Closers, doing initial database entry, organization and distribution of files, attaining proper signatures and ensuring that deadlines for the loans were met. Implemented new procedures for logging files upon arrival into the department, substantially increasing the efficiency and still in use today. Consulted with the Executive Loan Committee members when problems were found and worked to correct them to avoid delaying the loan closing timeline. Office Assistant Sarah and Company January 2009  –  May 2011  (2 years 5 months) San Francisco Bay Area As a children’s clothing wholesaler I did everything from answering phone calls and emails to showing the lines to customers and writing orders. I also sent orders to manufactures, designed display windows and sold samples in the retail store. Media Tech California College of the Arts 2008  –  May 2011  (3 years) San Francisco Bay Area As a Media Tech I ran the lighting, sound, and projections for any events that CCA hosted. I ran events such as Architecture Lectures, Comedy Shows, and Thesis Presentations. Summary As a highly motivated professional with experience in university program development for global industry executives, I was recently a Professional Education Program Coordinator at Stanford University. An exceptional attention to detail and the ability to multitask has given me the skills needed to manage and organize large projects and interact with people from all facets of the academic and executive world. Experience Professional Education Program Coordinator Stanford University March 2012  –  March 2015  (3 years 1 month) Palo Alto, CA •	Plan and coordinate multiple projects and events for Stanford Center for Professional Development (SCPD) within the Stanford School of Engineering 
•	Develop and manage web-based and in-class instructor-led courses within SCPD for international industry executives and students 
•	Develop relationships and provide customer service to participants and faculty before, during, and after events  
•	Manage logistics, registration, payment, and organization of course materials for events  
•	Train staff on basic SCPD assignments and event planning to more specific software designed for customer evaluations  
•	Design interdepartmental staff schedules for pre-planning and during events Paraeducator San Bernardino Superintendant of Schools January 2010  –  July 2011  (1 year 7 months) San Bernardino, CA •	Assisted educators in special education between K-12 and preschool  
•	One on one attention to individual students for both educational and personal needs 
•	Substitute teacher for the entire district, requiring the generation and execution of lesson plans Administrative Intern City of Riverside Human Resources July 2007  –  October 2007  (4 months) Riverside, CA •	Performed clerical skills essential to the operation of an office environment  
•	Handled the filing of employee disputes and created an efficient system for organizing private files  
•	Experience with human relations policies and filling of cases within HR department Intern Office of Mayor Ronald Loveridge January 2007  –  July 2007  (7 months) Riverside, CA •	Personally assisting mayoral staff in city projects, including the Multicultural Youth Festival, Mayor’s Night Out, and the Sendai Festival 
•	Main project involved researching the best practices of graffiti maintenance, which was followed by a written report. Summary Experienced Event Manager; I strive to deliver exceptional events from concept to execution within budgets  
• Event Manager for Stanford Center for Professional Development which grew from $20m annual revenue to $36m+ in 4 years; for all aspects of event services with events ranging from 10 to 800 executives and 95-120 programs annually  
• Broad project management experience with expected May 2015 completion of Advanced Project Management certificate from Stanford University  
• Eight years of event and logistics experience that included designing, building, and leading the event services team at Stanford Center for Professional Development while advising and helping build more efficient processes  
• Well rounded leader due to diverse work experience; can switch to varied tasks expertly and keep multiple programs running simultaneously while maintaining focus on business priorities  
• Creative, reliable and resourceful problem solver with multiple events, timeline management and variables working independently and with teams, depending on the program Summary Experienced Event Manager; I strive to deliver exceptional events from concept to execution within budgets
